hints.label: def-regge-curvature
hints.title: Regge Curvature
hints.content:
373: :label: def-regge-curvature
374: 
375: Let $\mathcal{T}$ be a simplicial complex (triangulation or Voronoi dual) in $d$ dimensions. For each $(d-2)$-simplex (hinge) $h$, define the **deficit angle**:
376: 
377: $$
378: \theta_h := 2\pi - \sum_{\sigma \supset h} \alpha_\sigma(h)
379: $$
380: 
381: where $\alpha_\sigma(h)$ is the dihedral angle at $h$ in $d$-simplex $\sigma$.
382: 
383: The **Regge curvature** concentrated at hinge $h$ is:
384: 
385: $$
386: R_{\text{Regge}}(h) := \frac{\theta_h}{|h|}
387: $$
388:
hints.raw_directive:
370: ### 3.1 Regge Curvature on Simplicial Complexes
371: 
372: :::{prf:definition} Regge Curvature
373: :label: def-regge-curvature
374: 
375: Let $\mathcal{T}$ be a simplicial complex (triangulation or Voronoi dual) in $d$ dimensions. For each $(d-2)$-simplex (hinge) $h$, define the **deficit angle**:
376: 
377: $$
378: \theta_h := 2\pi - \sum_{\sigma \supset h} \alpha_\sigma(h)
379: $$
380: 
381: where $\alpha_\sigma(h)$ is the dihedral angle at $h$ in $d$-simplex $\sigma$.
382: 
383: The **Regge curvature** concentrated at hinge $h$ is:
384: 
385: $$
386: R_{\text{Regge}}(h) := \frac{\theta_h}{|h|}
387: $$
388: 
389: where $|h|$ is the $(d-2)$-dimensional volume of $h$.

hints.label: thm-regge-convergence-rigorous
hints.title: Regge Calculus Convergence
hints.content:
396: :label: thm-regge-convergence-rigorous
397: 
398: Let $(M, g)$ be a smooth Riemannian $d$-manifold. Let $\{\mathcal{T}_N\}$ be a sequence of triangulations with mesh size $\delta_N \to 0$ as $N \to \infty$.
399: 
400: Assume the triangulations are **shape-regular**: There exist constants $0 < c_{\min} < c_{\max}$ such that all simplices $\sigma$ satisfy:
401: 
402: $$
403: c_{\min} \leq \frac{\text{inradius}(\sigma)}{\text{diameter}(\sigma)} \leq c_{\max}
404: $$
405: 
406: Then the Regge curvature converges to the Riemannian sectional curvature:
407: 
408: $$
409: R_{\text{Regge}}(h_N) \to K_g(P) \quad \text{as } N \to \infty
410: $$
411: 
412: where $P$ is the 2-plane containing $h_N$ and $K_g(P)$ is the sectional curvature.
413: 
414: **Convergence Rate**: If $g \in C^{k,\alpha}$ with $k \geq 3$, then:
415: 
416: $$
417: |R_{\text{Regge}}(h_N) - K_g(P)| = O(\delta_N^2)
418: $$
419:
hints.raw_directive:
393: **Connection to Riemannian Curvature**:

396: :label: thm-regge-convergence-rigorous
397: 
398: Let $(M, g)$ be a smooth Riemannian $d$-manifold. Let $\{\mathcal{T}_N\}$ be a sequence of triangulations with mesh size $\delta_N \to 0$ as $N \to \infty$.
399: 
400: Assume the triangulations are **shape-regular**: There exist constants $0 < c_{\min} < c_{\max}$ such that all simplices $\sigma$ satisfy:
401: 
402: $$
403: c_{\min} \leq \frac{\text{inradius}(\sigma)}{\text{diameter}(\sigma)} \leq c_{\max}
404: $$
405: 
406: Then the Regge curvature converges to the Riemannian sectional curvature:
407: 
408: $$
409: R_{\text{Regge}}(h_N) \to K_g(P) \quad \text{as } N \to \infty
410: $$
411: 
412: where $P$ is the 2-plane containing $h_N$ and $K_g(P)$ is the sectional curvature.
413:

hints.label: lem-cvt-shape-regular
hints.title: CVT Shape Regularity
hints.content:
429: :label: lem-cvt-shape-regular
430: 
431: Let $\rho(x)$ be a smooth, positive density on a compact domain $\Omega$ with $\inf_\Omega \rho > 0$ and $\sup_\Omega \rho < \infty$.
432: 
433: Then the Centroidal Voronoi Tessellation for $\rho$ with $N$ generators is **quasi-uniform** in the sense:
434: 
435: $$
436: \frac{\max_i \text{diam}(\mathcal{V}_i)}{\min_j \text{diam}(\mathcal{V}_j)} = O(1)
437: $$
438: 
439: as $N \to \infty$.
440: 
441: **Proof Sketch**:
442: 
443: For CVT, the generator distribution approximates $\rho$ via:
444: 
445: $$
446: \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{x_i} \approx \frac{\rho}{\int \rho}
447: $$
448: 
449: If $\rho$ is bounded above and below, then generators are **quasi-uniformly** distributed: no region is over-sampled or under-sampled by more than a constant factor.
450: 
451: This implies all Voronoi cells have comparable size:
452: 
453: $$
454: |\mathcal{V}_i| \sim N^{-1}
455: $$
456: 
457: and comparable shape (roughly isotropic), satisfying the shape-regularity condition.
458:
hints.raw_directive:
426: **Issue**: The theorem above assumes **shape-regular** triangulations. Are Voronoi tessellations shape-regular?
427: 
428: :::{prf:lemma} CVT Shape Regularity
429: :label: lem-cvt-shape-regular
430: 
431: Let $\rho(x)$ be a smooth, positive density on a compact domain $\Omega$ with $\inf_\Omega \rho > 0$ and $\sup_\Omega \rho < \infty$.
432: 
433: Then the Centroidal Voronoi Tessellation for $\rho$ with $N$ generators is **quasi-uniform** in the sense:
434: 
435: $$
436: \frac{\max_i \text{diam}(\mathcal{V}_i)}{\min_j \text{diam}(\mathcal{V}_j)} = O(1)
437: $$
438: 
439: as $N \to \infty$.
440: 
441: **Proof Sketch**:
442: 
443: For CVT, the generator distribution approximates $\rho$ via:
444: 
445: $$
446: \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{x_i} \approx \frac{\rho}{\int \rho}
447: $$
448: 
449: If $\rho$ is bounded above and below, then generators are **quasi-uniformly** distributed: no region is over-sampled or under-sampled by more than a constant factor.
450: 
451: This implies all Voronoi cells have comparable size:
452: 
453: $$
454: |\mathcal{V}_i| \sim N^{-1}
455: $$
456: 
457: and comparable shape (roughly isotropic), satisfying the shape-regularity condition.
458: 
459: **Reference**: Du, Q., et al. (2003). "Convergence of the Lloyd algorithm for computing centroidal Voronoi tessellations". *SIAM J. Numer. Anal.* **41**(4), 1443-1478.

hints.label: thm-scutoid-ricci-convergence
hints.title: Scutoid Ricci Tensor Converges to Riemannian Ricci Tensor
hints.content:
466: :label: thm-scutoid-ricci-convergence
467: 
468: Let $\rho_t(x)$ be a smooth, positive spatial density from the Fractal Set at time $t$. Let $\{x_i\}_{i=1}^N$ be walkers distributed according to $\rho_t$, forming a Voronoi tessellation $\{\mathcal{V}_i\}$.
469: 
470: Define the scutoid Ricci tensor as in Chapter 15:
471: 
472: $$
473: R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}} = \lim_{\Delta x \to 0} \frac{1}{\text{Vol}(\mathcal{B}_\mu)} \sum_{P \ni x^\mu} \theta_P n_P^\mu n_P^\nu
474: $$
475: 
476: Then as $N \to \infty$:
477: 
478: $$
479: R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\rho_t](x) \to R_{\mu\nu}[g[\rho_t]](x)
480: $$
481: 
482: where $R_{\mu\nu}[g]$ is the **Riemannian Ricci tensor** of the metric $g_{ij}[\rho_t]$ defined by optimal transport / CVT ({prf:ref}`lem-emergent-equals-ot`).
483: 
484: **Convergence Rate**:
485: 
486: $$
487: \left|R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}} - R_{\mu\nu}[g]\right| = O(N^{-2/d})
488: $$
489: 
490: assuming $\rho_t \in C^{3,\alpha}$.
491: 
492: **Proof**:
493: 
494: **Step 1**: By {prf:ref}`lem-cvt-shape-regular`, the Voronoi tessellation is shape-regular.
495: 
496: **Step 2**: By {prf:ref}`thm-regge-convergence-rigorous`, the Regge curvature (deficit angles) converges to the sectional curvature $K_g$ of the metric $g$.
497: 
498: **Step 3**: The Ricci tensor is obtained by contracting the Riemann tensor:
499: 
500: $$
501: R_{\mu\nu} = \sum_{k} R_{\mu k \nu k}
502: $$
503: 
504: In the discretization, this corresponds to summing deficit angles over all plaquettes containing edge $(\mu, \nu)$, which is exactly the scutoid Ricci definition.
505: 
506: **Step 4**: The convergence rate follows from:
507: - CVT mesh size: $\delta_N = O(N^{-1/d})$
508: - Regge convergence: $O(\delta_N^2) = O(N^{-2/d})$
509:
